nodes.documentation:
@notice This is a helper function that prepends the ERC191 signed message prefix
@param _preimage This is the reconstructed message hash before being prepened with the ERC191 prefix
nodes.name: generatePrefixedPreimage

makePayment(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,bytes3.notice: Used to submit a payment for TEMPORAL uploads

verifyImages(bytes32,uint256,uint8,uint2.notice: This is a helper function used to verify whether or not the provided arguments can reconstruct the message hash

verifySigner(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,bytes.notice: This is a helper function which can be used to verify the signer of a message

makePayment(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,bytes3.details: Can use ERC191 or non ERC191 signed messages

params._chargeAmountInWei: This is how much the user is to be charged
params._h: This is the message hash that has been signed
params._paymentMethod: This is the payment method (RTC, ETH) being used
params._paymentNumber: This is the current payments number (how many payments the user has submitted)
params._prefixed: This indicates whether or not the signature was generated using ERC191 standards
params._r: This is pulled from the signature
params._s: This is pulled from the signature
params._v: This is pulled from the signature

params._chargeAmountInWei: This is the amount the user is to be charged
params._h: This is the message hash which is signed, and will be reconstructed
params._paymentMethod: This is the payment method (RTC, ETH) being used
params._paymentNumber: This is the number of payment
params._prefixed: This indicates whether the message was signed according to ERC191

params._chargeAmountInWei: This is the amount hte user is to be charged
params._h: This is the message hash that is signed
params._paymentMethod: This is the payment method (RTC, ETH) being used
params._paymentNumber: This is the payment number of this particular payment
params._prefixed: This indicates whether or not the message was signed using ERC191
params._r: This is pulled from the signature
